item.title: Notes on Econometrics
item.description: Matrix Algebra (Arbitrary) Linear Model OLS Estimator Derive \(b\) Efficienty OLS Residual Variance / Unbiased OLS Model R Workouts Monte Carlo Simulation & Check Gauss-Markov assumptions Rmd Reference Matrix Algebra PS1.Q1.1 Consider the matrix: \[M = \begin{pmatrix} \frac{1}{4} & \frac{\sqrt{3}}{4} \\ \frac{\sqrt{3}}{4} & \frac{1}{4} \end{pmatrix}\] Calculate the trace of \(λM′M\) where \(λ\) is a scalar. Check whether \(M\) is invertible and find the inverse if possible.

item.title: Notes on Econometrics: PS5
item.description: Q1 Q2 Q3 Q4 a) b) Q1 Show that \(\hat{β}_{IV} =(X′ZW_N Z′X)^{−1}X′ZW_N Z′y\) minimizes \[Q_N(β) = \Big[ \frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^N (y_i - x_i' β)z_i\Big]' W_N ​ \Big[ \frac{1}{N}\sum_{i=1}^N (y_i - x_i' β)z_i\Big]\] ​ \[= \Big[ \frac{1}{N}Z' (y - X β)\Big]' W_N ​ \Big[ \frac{1}{N}Z' (y - X β)\Big]\] \(Q_N(β) = \frac{1}{N^2}\Big[ (y' - β'X')Z W_N (Z'y - Z'X β)\Big]\) ——–\(= \frac{1}{N^2}\Big[ y'ZW_NZ'y - y'ZW_N Z'Xβ - β'X'Z W_N Z'y + β'X' Z W_N Z'yβ \Big]\)

item.title: Notes on Econometrics: PS4
item.description: Q1 a) b) c) d) e) f) g) Q2 a) b) c) d) e) f) g) h) i) library(repr) options(repr.plot.width=4,repr.plot.height=4) Q1 Consider the nonlinear consumption function \[c_t = α + γ y_t^δ\] where \(c_t\) is real consumption and yt labels real income and \(α ≥ 0\), \(γ > 0\) and \(δ > 0\) a) Can this function be linearized? no. \(\log(c_t) = \log(α + γ y_t^δ)\)

item.title: About
item.description: Hello. I’m loikein from China. Welcome to my academic blog. Currently I live in Bonn, Germany for my master’s study in economics. My research interests include microeconomic theory, experimental economics and game theory. I am also interested in computer science. I speak Chinese (native), Japanese (near native) and English (academic proficient). If you are a Chinese user, you may also want to check my personal blog: Untitled Life. This blog is powered by the blogdown package of R.

item.title: Notes on Econometrics: PS3
item.description: Q1 a) b) c) d) e) Q2 a) b) c) c) d) e) f) g) original (true) model library(repr) options(repr.plot.width=4, repr.plot.height=3) Q1 Consider the Cobb-Douglas production function \[Y =F(K,L)=τK^{β_1}L^{β_2}\] where \(F\) is the production function, \(K\) capital and \(L\) labor. Technology is assumed to be constant and represented by \(τ\). a) Which coefficients are elasticities? \(β_1\) and \(β_2\) proof: elasticity: \(\frac{\partial A}{\partial B}\cdot\frac{B}{A}\)

item.title: Notes on Econometrics: PS2
item.description: Q1 Q2 (a) (b) (c) (d) (e) Q3 (a) critical value (e) (f) Q4 (a) (b) dir() library(repr) options(repr.plot.width=4, repr.plot.height=3) Q1 Consider two linear regression models. In the first model only the regressors in a matrix X1 are used as explanatory variables for \(y\). The matrix \(X_1\) contains an intercept. In contrast, the second model uses the regressors in \(X_2\) as explanatory variables in addition to \(X_1\) for \(y\).

item.title: Rmd Template
item.description: Words of Warning Rmd Reference Reference Cheatsheet Inline Code Executed Display Code R Code Chunk R Code (Inline) Code from Other Languages Reference Image Reference Plot Words of Warning I use Typora to write my posts. It usually processes .Rmd file correctly, but it gets lost in a file as complicated as this one. Always check twice and preview the .html page. DO NOT put spaces right after and before the \(\LaTeX\) $ $ pair or the expression will not be rendered properly.
